algorithms.util

Class PolynomialFitter

  • java.lang.Object
    • algorithms.util.PolynomialFitter

  • public class PolynomialFitter
extends java.lang.Object
    methods associated with fitting a 2nd order polynomial curve.
    Author:
    nichole

      • solveAfterRandomSampling

        public float[] solveAfterRandomSampling(java.util.Set<PairInt> points)
        solve for 2nd order curve for a random sample of 1000 points from (dataX, dataY).
        Parameters:
        points -
        Returns:
        2nd order polynomial coefficients if solved, else null

      • solveAfterRandomSampling

        protected float[] solveAfterRandomSampling(java.util.Set<PairInt> points,
                                           java.security.SecureRandom sr)
        solve for 2nd order curve for a random sample of 1000 points from (dataX, dataY).
        Parameters:
        points -
        sr - instance of secure random to use for generating random numbers
        Returns:
        2nd order polynomial coefficients if solved, else null. the coefficients are used in y = c0*1 + c1*x[i] + c2*x[i]*x[i]

      • solve

        public float[] solve(float[] dataX,
                     float[] dataY)
        solve for 2nd order curves. This uses a Vandermonde matrix and QR decomposition. Note that the solver is not ideal for a mostly vertical polynomial with an extremely large gap separating two groups of points.
        Parameters:
        dataX -
        dataY -
        Returns:
        2nd order polynomial coefficients if solved, else null. The coefficients are used in y = c0*1 + c1*x[i] + c2*x[i]*x[i]

                                int plotXMax,
                                int plotYMax,
                                int plotNumber,
                                java.lang.String plotLabel)
        plot the points and 2nd order curve given the coefficients. note that if there are more than 1000 points, only 1000 of them are
        Parameters:
        coefficients -
        points -
        plotXMax -
        plotYMax -
        plotNumber -
        plotLabel -
        Returns:

      • determineGoodEndPoints

        public float[] determineGoodEndPoints(float[] coefficients,
                                      java.util.Set<PairInt> points)
        determine good end points for the polynomial fit to the points. runtime complexity is O(N*lg_2(N)) + O(N)
        Parameters:
        coefficients -
        points -
        Returns:
        float[]{minX, YForMinX, maxX, YFoMaxX}

      • calcResiduals

        public double calcResiduals(float[] coefficients,
                            java.util.Set<PairInt> points)
        calculate the square root of the sum of the squared differences between a 2nd order polygon defined by the given coefficients and the given points. Note that if coefficients or points are null or empty, it returns a result of infinity.
        Parameters:
        coefficients -
        points -
        Returns:
